imapper Package¶

errorbars Module¶

imapper.errorbars.autopower_errorbars(k, power, params)¶

Calculate the error bars on P(k) (1-sigma uncertainty) as a function of k.

This is a convenience method, which calls the internal method.

Parameters :

k : 1D array

Values of k at which to calculate error bars on the power spectrum. [1/Mpc]

power : 1D array

Autopower spectrum at the corresponding values of k. Should be the same length as k. [uK^2 Mpc^3]
imapper.errorbars.autopower_noise_error(power, tsys, nfeeds, tobs, xarclen, yarclen, fwhm, nu_min, nu_max, dnu, nu0, k, cosmo, verbose=False)¶

Get instrument sensitivity in power spectrum, provided a set of instrument parameters Required parameters for:

Parameters :

power : ndarray

must have same length as k

tsys : float

System temperature [K]

nfeeds

Number of feeds

tobs

Total observing time [s]

xarclen

Length of FOV [arcmin]

fwhm

FWHM of beam [arcmin]

nu_min

minimum observing frequency [GHz]

nu_max

maximum observing frequency [GHz]

dnu

frequency resolution [GHz]

nu0

rest-frame line frequency [GHz]

k : array

a vector of k at which to calculate power noise

cosmo : astropy.cosmology object

For cosmology calculations
Returns :

sigma_power : array

Expected error bars in power spectrum as a function of k. Units of [uK^2 * Mpc^3]. Same dimensions as k.

noise_power : array

nmodes : array

res_factor : array
imapper.errorbars.crosspower_noise_sens(instrument1_params, instrument2_params, cosmology, verbose=True)¶

Get instrument sensitivity in power spectrum, provided a set of instrument parameters Required parameters for:

instrument_params – tsys – dnu – nfeeds – tobs – area – fwhm – zobs – zmin – zmax – nu0 – k

cosmology – h – omega_M_0 – omega_lambda_0

imapper.errorbars.dco_between(zlo, zhi, cosmo)¶

Calculate the comoving distance [Mpc] between two redshifts in a given cosmology.

imapper.errorbars.fwhm_to_sigma(fwhm)¶

Calculate Gaussian sigma (standard deviation) from FWHM value.

The relation between them is: fwhm = sqrt(8ln2) * sigma

imapper.errorbars.kmax_parallel(zobs, nu_obs, dnu, cosmo)¶

Calculate maximum k (along line of sight) from frequency resolution

imapper.errorbars.kmax_perpendicular(d_comoving, sigma_beam, mode=None)¶

Calculate maximum k (across sky) from angular resolution

d_comoving : comoving radial distance (pre-calculated from redshift) [Mpc] sigma_beam : arc length of beam width [radians] mode : if ‘lidz11’, use incorrect formula of Lidz+11 (and Gong+12)

imapper.errorbars.num_modes(k, vol)¶

Calculate the number of modes in a given volume as a function of k.

There is a factor of 1/2 out front because the 3D intensity map is real-valued, so only half the modes are independent.

imapper.errorbars.res_damping(k, kmax_par, kmax_prp, nmu=100)¶

Resolution-limit “damping” factor on the power spectrum, as a function of k

Parameters :

k : ndarray

kmax_par : float

kmax_prp : float

nmu : int
imapper.errorbars.sigma_radiometer(area_surv, area_res, tobs, tsys, dnu, nfeeds)¶

Calculate sensitivity per voxel by evaluating the radiometer equation.

Parameters :

area_surv [deg^2] : Area of full survey

area_res [arcmin^2] : Area of angular resolution (beam size)

tobs [s] : Total observing time

tsys [K] : System temperature

dnu [GHz] : Voxel width in frequency

nfeeds : Number of collecting feeds
Returns :

sigma : expected temperature fluctuation per pixel [uK]
imapper.errorbars.voxel_volume(dco, sig_beam, nu_rest, nu_obs, dnu, cosmo)¶

Get comoving voxel volume

dco : comoving distance sig_beam : beam width nu_rest : rest frame line frequency nu_obs : observed frequency dnu : frequency channel width cosmo : astropy.cosmology object (contains cosmological info)

functions Module¶

Helper functions for intensity mapping code.

Parameters :

arrays of bin edges in (arcmin, arcmin, and [freq]) respectively

nurest : float

rest frame frequency of spectral line of interest
Returns :

3d array of redshifts (will only vary in depth, aka z, direction)

Returns :

imapper.functions.load_halos(params, filenum=None, verbose=True)¶

Load halo catalog, and store halo properties in a HaloList object (see ‘halolist’ module).

The location of the halo data should be stored in ‘params’ as a string. The file itself should in the *.npz format, and the halo properties included must be:
x y z m ra dec ...[unfinished]
Parameters :

params

dictionary containing all parameter values
Returns :

halos : HaloList object

object containing halo properties
imapper.functions.lsun_to_uk(lum, nurest, vol, redshift, cosmo)¶

total luminosity within spectral bin [Lsun]

nurest : float

vol : float or array

redshift : float or array

redshift

cosmo : astropy.cosmology object
Returns :

temprj : float or array

Rayleigh-Jeans brightness temperature

imapper.functions.uk_to_mjy(t_uK, nu_GHz, th_arcmin)¶

Convert brightness temperature [uK] to flux density [mJy].

See equation at https://science.nrao.edu/facilities/vla/proposing/TBconv:
T = 1.36 * ( lambda[cm]^2 / theta[arcsec]^2 ) * S[mJy/beam]
Parameters :

t_uK: brightness temperature in uK

nu_GHz: frequency in GHz th_arcmin: FWHM in arcmin
Returns :

s_mJy (float): flux density in mJy
imapper.functions.z_to_comovingMpc(redshift, cosmo)¶

Convert redshift to comoving depth.

grid Module¶

Module containing IMGrid, a class for grid objects, as well as helper functions

class imapper.grid.IMGrid(params, verbose=True)¶

Bases: object

Object storing intensity mapping grids.

This is useful for conserving memory in case repeated runs are necessary within the same volume (e.g. when sampling parameter space during an MCMC run).

Contains the following attributes - angfreqbins: ang x ang x freq bins - lumcube: luminosities in each grid cell (not necessarily defined at creation) The binning in each should be equivalent (i.e. objects in the ijk-th bin of the ang-ang-freq grid should also be in the same ijk-th bin of the comoving grid).

imapper.grid.angfreq_to_comov_grid(angfreqbins, params, verbose=True)¶

Convert a field on an (ang x ang x freq) grid to a 3D comoving grid

Parameters :

angfreqbins : tuple or list of arrays, length (M+1, N+1, P+1)

bin edges of angular and frequency directions

nu_z0 : float

observed (redshifted) frequency of mapped line at z=0
imapper.grid.getangfreqbins(params)¶

Get data cube bins in angular and frequency coordinates.

The 3D data cube is assumed to have 2 angular (x,y) and 1 frequency (z) dimensions. Units are arcmin for angle, GHz for frequency.

Parameters :

params : parameter object
Returns :

abins : 1D array

Angular bins edges in x direction [arcmin]

abins : 1D array

Angular bins edges in y direction [arcmin]

fbins : 1D array

Frequency bins edges in z direction [GHz]

halolco Module¶

Module for calculating line luminosities from halos.

Broadly speaking, halos come in, line luminosities go out.

imapper.halolco.co_sled(j, mode='thermal')¶

Returns luminosity normalization factor L(j -> j-1)/L(1 -> 0)

imapper.halolco.halotolco_preset(mass, mode)¶

Preset LCO-Mhalo scaling, from previous studies

Parameters :

mass : float or array

halo masses in Msun

mode : string

Which preset halo-lco relation to use. Acceptable values:

‘righi08’ : Righi et al. 2008 ‘visbal10’ : Visbal & Loeb 2010 ‘lidz11’ : Lidz et al. 2011 ‘pullen13A’ : Pullen et al. 2013 (model A) ‘pullen13B’ : Pullen et al. 2013 (model B)
imapper.halolco.lir_to_lcoprime(lir, alpha=1.37, beta=-1.74)¶

Compute LCO’ from LIR assuming a power-law relation between them.

Assumed LIR-LCO’ relation of the form:
log(LIR) = alpha * log(LCO’) + beta

This function inverts that relation. alpha=1.37, beta=-1.74 are values from Carilli+Walter13.

imapper.halolco.logscatter(x, dexscatter)¶

Return array x, randomly scattered by a log-normal distribution with sigma=dexscatter. Maintain mean in linear space (not log space).

imapper.halolco.lprime_to_l(lprime, nurest)¶

Convert L’ (integrated brightness temperature) to L (luminosity)

lprime : area- and velocity-integrated brightness temperature [K km/s pc^2]

nurest : Rest-frame line frequency [GHz]

imapper.halolco.mhalo_to_sfr(halos, params, verbose=True, reuse_sfr=False)¶

Assign SFRs to dark matter halos.

This is the first step in the halo-LCO conversion.

imapper.halolco.powerlaw(x, pow, prefac)¶
imapper.halolco.sfr_bwc13(mass, redshift, mode=None)¶

SFR(M,z) relation of Behroozi, Wechsler, and Conroy 2013

Takes in Mhalo and redshift, returns an interpolated SFR

redshift : float
redshift at which to interpolate
mass : float array
halo masses
mode : None or str
None : default mode, uses ‘sfr_release’ values from paper ‘lo’ : uses sfr - error ‘hi’ : uses sfr + error
imapper.halolco.sfr_bwc13_scatter(mass, redshift, scatter=0.25, mode='dex')¶
imapper.halolco.sfr_to_lco(halos, params, verbose=True)¶

Convert SFR to LCO

This is the 2nd step in the halo-LCO conversion.

imapper.halolco.sfr_to_lco_shortcut1(sfr, alpha, beta, deltamf)¶

Implementation of: log LCO = log SFR

  • 10
  • alpha*[ log3 + 3log115 -11 ]
  • beta - log(deltamf)
imapper.halolco.sfr_to_lir(sfr, deltamf=1.5)¶

Convert SFR to LIR using Kennicutt98 relation.

imapping Module¶

imapper.imapping.get_halo_cellidx(hxa, hya, hzf, angfreqbins)¶

cellidx :

imapper.imapping.lcube_to_tcube(lcube, angfreqbins, nurest, cosmo, params, verbose=True)¶
imapper.imapping.lhalo_to_lcube(hxa, hya, hzf, hlco, angfreqbins, nurest, cosmo, hbinidx=None, verbose=True)¶

[placeholder]

imapper.imapping.lum_to_tcube(halos, imgrid, params, verbose=True)¶

Convenience wrapper function. Calculates brightness temperature cube, given source (halo) luminosities and positions.

Returns 1D coordinate array and a 3D numpy array: 2 angular dimensions (transverse on sky), 1 frequency dimension (depth).

Parameters :

halos : HaloList object

params : dict
Returns :

xang : float array

first dimension of transverse angular distance on sky

yang : float array

second dimension of transverse angular distance on sky

zfreq : float array

third dimension of frequency. For signals originating from a single spectral line (e.g. CO(1-0)), this corresponds to depth

tcube : float array

brightness temperature data cube. For coordinates given by (xang[xi], yang[yi], zfreq[zi]), where (xi, yi, zi) are array indices, the corresponding brightness temperature is tcube[xi, yi, zi].

mapit Module¶

Command line executable for running the intensity mapper.

Usage:

mapit.py [parameter_file]

imapper.mapit.get_args()¶
imapper.mapit.get_halos(params)¶

Returns HaloList object (with selection cuts applied, etc)

imapper.mapit.get_powercyl(imgrid)¶

Return kprp, kpar, P(kprp, kpar) of cylindrically averaged power spectrum

imapper.mapit.get_powersph(imgrid)¶

Return k, P(k) of spherically averaged power spectrum

imapper.mapit.main()¶
